title: Exploring an erstwhile princely city of Gujarat- Vadodara (sandeep m)
text: By sandeep m Aug 26, 2015 Vadodara is situated in the state of Gujarat. Vadodara, the cultural capital of the state, has everything for holidaying. It is a perfect place for the history buff. A 2-3 day trip is enough to explore the city. Read on for more information.Vadodara, a former princely state on the bank of Vishwamitri River, is a known place in India. Also known as Baroda, it is the 3rd largest city of Gujarat. The city is wrapped in rich culture and history. Vadodara has witnessed the rules of different dynasties. After Mughals, it was the Maratha Gaekwads who established their capital here and ruled until the independence of India. The aura of the past is still visible in some of the remaining structures. Vadodara being the cultural capital of Gujarat is fast growing along with Ahmedabad and Surat. It is also an important educational and industrial hub of the state.Vadodara has its own charm and it is one of the most visited places of the state. A great fusion of past and modernization, the city offers a pleasant experience to the visitors. On one side, the palace and on the other side the IT sector, this Sanskriti Nagari offers a unique memory to cherish lifelong. Vadodara hotels are all set to welcome their guests throughout the year. So, when you reach the place you will find an ample number of hotels in Vadodara which will offer a comfortable stay.Lakshmi Vilas Palace is the major attraction of the place. The magnificent artefacts and the style of architecture are amazing. It was formerly the residence of the Gaekwad family and it is known for the largest private dwelling built till date. The grand Darbar Hall will mesmerise you. The effects and the blend of European style of architecture with Indian art are worth witnessing. This huge palace is one of the city's main claim to fame. Spread over 700 acres of Land the Palace is open to visitors all day of the week except Monday. The ticket costs rs. 150 per person and it will take 2-3 hours to explore the whole Palace. Apart from this, Maharaj Sayajirao University Museum, the Nazarbaugh Palace, Makarpura Palace, Sursagar Talav, Sayaji Baug built by Maharaja Sayajirao II, etc. will surely win your heart. The city has many things to explore and enjoy. When you are in Vadodara you will enjoy every bit of it.Regular flights connect Delhi and Mumbai to Vadodara. The airport is only 6.2 km from the city centre and reaching Vadodara by airways is one of the most comfortable means of travelling. Vadodara railway station is connected to all the major cities. You have to take a bus, taxi or cab to reach the city from the railway station. Gujarat State bus services the whole state. And a number of cabs, taxis and private buses ply to Vadodara from different parts of the state.Vadodara can be explores any time of the year. The city ensures a comfortable tour to its visitors. If you wish to stay in the 5 star hotels in Vadodara, Welcome hotel, the Gateway hotel Akota, Royal Orchid Central Akota are some of the popular luxury hotels which will take care of your stay. About the Author Sandeep is an experienced travel writer and enthusiast blogger. He has explored many known and less-known places in India in the last 10 years.
